source.title: Gold and silver coins stolen from French museum hours after Louvre heist - The Washington Post
source.name: The Washington Post

facts: Robbery of historical coins from a museum dedicated to philosopher Denis Diderot

neutral.headline: French Museum Heist: Crown Jewels and Coins Stolen Post-Louvre Robbery
neutral.body_html: The recent theft at a French museum dedicated to philosopher Denis Diderot has brought attention back to France after last month's Louvre heist. The stolen items included historical coins valued around $100,000 and also drew focus due to its proximity in timing with another high-profile theft.

conservative.headline: French Museum Heist: Crown Jewels Stolen After Louvre Robbery
conservative.body_html: In a separate crime, French crown jewels were stolen from another museum in France. The theft occurred shortly after an incident at the Louvre where valuable items including historical coins worth around $100,000 belonging to philosopher Denis Diderot's dedicated museum were also taken.

liberal.headline: French Museum Heist: Historic Coins and Crown Jewels Stolen in Series of Crimes
liberal.body_html: In a series of crimes that have shocked France, historical coins worth around $100,000 from the museum dedicated to philosopher Denis Diderot were stolen just hours after another heist at the Louvre. The French crown jewels also fell victim to thieves in what appears as a coordinated effort targeting national treasures.
